00063 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00064 
00065     /* Kernel mode side */
00066     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00077     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00078     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00079 
00080 } xnarchtcb_t;

00180 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00181 
00182 {
00183     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00184 
00185     rthal_load_cpuid();
00186 
00187     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00188        and always inside a critical section. */
00189     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00190     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00191     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00192     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00193     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00194 }

00196 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00197 {
00198     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00199 }

00201 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00202                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00203                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00204                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00205                                     )
00206 {
00207 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00208 
00209     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00210         "pushfl\n\t" \
00211         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00212         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00213         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00214         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00215         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00216         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00217         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00218         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00219         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00220         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00221         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00222         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00223         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00224         "ret\n\t" \
00225 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00226         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00227         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00228         "popfl\n\t" \
00229       : /* no output */ \
00230       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00231         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00232         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00233         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00234         "b" (out_tcb), \
00235         "S" (in_tcb), \
00236         "a" (outproc), \
00237         "d" (inproc));
00238 
00239 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00240 
00241     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00242     
00243     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00244         "pushfl\n\t" \
00245         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00246         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00247         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00248         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00249         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00250         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00251         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00252         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00253         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00254         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00255         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00256         "ret\n\t" \
00257 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00258         "popfl\n\t" \
00259       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00260         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00261         "=S" (esi_out), \
00262         "=D" (edi_out), \
00263         "+a" (outproc), \
00264         "+d" (inproc) \
00265       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00266         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00267         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00268         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00269 
00270 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00271 }

00273 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00274                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00275 {
00276     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00277     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00278     unsigned long fs, gs;
00279 
00280     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00281         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00282            clear the ts bit. */
00283         clts();
00284     
00285     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00286 
00287     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00288         {
00289         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00290 
00291         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00292 
00293         if (!inproc->mm)
00294             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00295         }
00296 
00297     if (out_tcb->user_task) {
00298        /* Make sure that __switch_to() will always reload the correct
00299           %fs and %gs registers, even if we happen to migrate the task
00300           across domains in the meantime. */
00301         asm volatile("mov %%fs,%0":"=m" (fs));
00302         asm volatile("mov %%gs,%0":"=m" (gs));
00303     }
00304 
00305     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00306 
00307     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00308 
00309         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00310 
00311         loadsegment(fs, fs);
00312         loadsegment(gs, gs);
00313 
00314         barrier();
00315 
00316         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00317            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00318            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00319            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00320            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00321            raw I/O ops. */
00322 
00323         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00324             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, rthal_processor_id());
00325 
00326             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00327                 
00328                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00329 
00330                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00331                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00332                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00333                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00334 
00335                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00336                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00337             }
00338         }
00339     }
00340 
00341     stts();
00342 }

00367 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00368                                                int imask,
00369                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00370                                                void *cookie)
00371 {
00372     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00373     stts();
00374     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00375     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00376     entry(cookie);
00377     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00378 }

00380 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00381                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00382                                        void *cookie,
00383                                        int imask,
00384                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00385                                        char *name)
00386 {
00387     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00388 
00389     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00390     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00391     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00392     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00393     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00394     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00395     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00396     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00397     *--(*psp) = 0;
00398 }

00410 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00411 
00412 {
00413     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00414     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00415        task. */
00416 
00417     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00418 
00419     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00420         {
00421         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00422         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00423         }
00424 
00425     if(task)
00426         {
00427         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00428           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00429           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00430         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00431         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00432         }   
00433 }
00434 
00435 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00436 
00437 {
00438     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00439     
00440     if(task)
00441         {
00442         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00443             return;
00444 
00445         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00446            of this task. */
00447         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00448         }
00449 
00450     clts();
00451     
00452     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00453         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00454     else
00455         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00456 }
00457 
00458 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00459 
00460 {
00461     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00462 
00463     if (task)
00464         {
00465         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00466             {
00467             stts();
00468             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00469             }
00470 
00471         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00472            hardware. */
00473         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00474         }
00475 
00476     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00477        user-space or kernel thread. */
00478     clts();
00479 
00480     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00481         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00482     else
00483         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00484 }
00485 
00486 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00487 
00488 {
00489     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00490 
00491     if (task && !(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00492         return;
00493 
00494     clts();
00495 
00496     if (!cpu_has_fxsr && task)
00497         /* fnsave, called by switch_to, initialized the FPU state, so that on
00498            cpus prior to PII (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved
00499            state. */
00500         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00501 }

00555 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00556

00558     unsigned irq;
00559 
00560     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)

00562                              irq,

00568 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00569 
00570 {
00571     unsigned irq;
00572 
00573     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00574         {
00575         switch (irq)
00576             {
00577 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00578             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00579             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00580             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00581             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00582 
00583                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00584                 continue;
00585 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00586 
00587             default:
00588 
00589                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00590             }
00591         }
00592 }

00594 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00595 
00596 {
00597     unsigned irq;
00598 
00599     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00600         {
00601         switch (irq)
00602             {
00603 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00604             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00605             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00606             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00607             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00608 
00609                 continue;
00610 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00611 
00612             default:
00613 
00614                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00615             }
00616         }
00617 }

00623 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay)
00624 {
00625     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00626        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00627        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00628        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00629     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00630 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_LATENCY
00631     extern unsigned long rthal_maxlat_tsc;
00632     rthal_nmi_arm(delay + rthal_maxlat_tsc);
00633 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_NMI_LATENCY */
00634 }

00669 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00670 {
00671     struct pt_regs *regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00672     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00673 
00674     fltinfo.vector = event;
00675     fltinfo.errcode = regs->orig_eax;
00676     fltinfo.regs = regs;
00677

00681 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00682 
00683 {
00684 #if CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00685     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00686 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00687     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00688        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00689        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00690        configuration Xenomai is compiled against,
00691        CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00692        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00693     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00694 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00695 }
00696 
00697 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00698 
00699 {
00700     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00701 
00702     if (!nktimerlat)
00703         return -ENODEV;
00704 
00705     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00706 
00707     return 0;
00708 }

00710 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00711 
00712 {
00713     int err;
00714 
00715 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00716     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00717        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00718     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00719 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00720 
00721     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00722 
00723     if (err)
00724         return err;
00725 
00726     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00727 
00728     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00729         return -ENOSYS;
00730 
00731     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00732                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00733                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00734                          NULL,
00735                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00736 
00737     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00738 
00739 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00740     err = xnshadow_mount();
00741 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */
00742 
00743     if (err)
00744         {
00745         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00746         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00747         }
00748 
00749     return err;
00750 }
